metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7656 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: jquery prior to 1.9.0 allows Cross-site Scripting attacks via the load method. The load method fails to recognize and remove "<script>" HTML tags that contain a whitespace character, i.e: "</script >", which results in the enclosed script logic to be executed.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is likely an intrusive, backwards-incompatible change that may break existing software. We will not be fixing this issue in stable Ubuntu releases.

criterions.comment: jquery: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
